colspan=3 style="background-color: #D9E8FF; text-align: center;" {{!}} '''''Awards Won''''' {{!}}- |- bgcolor=#D9E8FF | style="text-align:center;" | '''Award''' | style="text-align:center;background: #cceecc;text-size:0.9em" width=50| '''Won''' |- bgcolor=#ffdddd |align="center"| ;ACE Eddie Award |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 1 |- bgcolor=#ffdddd |align="center"| ;[[ASCAP|ASCAP Film & Television Awards]] |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 6 |- bgcolor=#eeeeff |align="center"| ;[[British Comedy Awards]] |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 1 |- bgcolor=#ddddff |align="center"| ;[[Directors Guild of America Award]]s |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 3 |- bgcolor=#eeeeff |align="center"| ;[[Golden Globe Award]]s |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 3 |- bgcolor=#eeeeff |align="center"| ;[[People's Choice Award]]s |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 4 |- bgcolor=#ddddff |align="center"| ;[[Primetime Emmy Award]]s |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 10 |- bgcolor=#ddddff |align="center"| ;[[Screen Actors Guild Awards]] |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 6 |- bgcolor=#ddddff |align="center"| ;[[Writers Guild of America Award]]s |style="text-align:center;background: #ddffdd;vertical-align: middle;"| 4 {{!}}} |- bgcolor=#D9E8FF | style="text-align:center;" | '''''Total Awards Won''''' | colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-size:0.9em;vertical-align: middle;" width=50| '''41+''' |- bgcolor=#D9E8FF | colspan="3" style="font-size: smaller; text-align:center;" | [[#References|Footnotes]] |} This is a list of notable '''awards and nominations received by ''[[Seinfeld]]''''', an [[United States|American]] [[situation comedy|sitcom]]. It has won 10 [[Emmy Award|Emmys]], 3 [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globes]], and many other awards. ==Awards and nominations== === [[Golden Globe Award]]s === ''Seinfeld'' won three Golden Globes in 1994. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Category ! Nominee ! Result |- |1993 |Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for TV |Jason Alexander |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |rowspan=4|1994 |Best TV-Series - Comedy/Musical | |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a TV-Series - Comedy/Musical |Jerry Seinfeld |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for TV |Jason Alexander |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Series, Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for TV |Julia Louis-Dreyfus |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |rowspan=4|1995 |Best TV-Series - Comedy/Musical | |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a TV-Series - Comedy/Musical |Jerry Seinfeld |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for TV |Jason Alexander |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Series, Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for TV |Julia Louis-Dreyfus |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |rowspan=2|1996 |Best TV-Series - Comedy/Musical | |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a TV-Series - Comedy/Musical |Jerry Seinfeld |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |1997 |Best TV-Series - Comedy/Musical | |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |rowspan=3|1998 |Best TV-Series - Comedy/Musical | |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a TV-Series - Comedy/Musical |Jerry Seinfeld |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for TV |Jason Alexander |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |} ===[[Primetime Emmy Award]]s=== ''Seinfeld'' has won 10 [[Primetime Emmy Awards]], but has been nominated for 68 Emmys. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Category ! Nominee ! Result |- |1990 |Outstanding Editing for a Miniseries or a Special |Robert Souders |style="background: #ffdddd"| Nominated |- |rowspan=3|1991 |Outstanding Writing in a Comedy Series |Larry David and Jerry Seinfeld

{{small|for "[[The Betrayal]]"}} |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |} === [[Writers Guild of America|Writers Guild]] Awards === ''Seinfeld'' has won four [[Writers Guild of America Award]]s. {| class="wikitable" |- ! {{small|for "[[The Fatigues (Seinfeld episode)|The Fatigues]]"}} |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |} === ASCAP Film & Television Awards === The Top TV Series Category, honors [[ASCAP]] composers who have written the themes and underscore for the highest rated series during the period of January 1 - December 31. Composer Jonathan Wolff has won 6 awards in Top TV series category, from 1994 to 1999. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Category ! Nominee ! Result |- |1994 |Top TV Series[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0098904/awards ''Seinfeld'' awards on IMDB] |[[Jonathan Wolff (musician)|Jonathan Wolff]] |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |1995 |Top TV Series |[[Jonathan Wolff (musician)|Jonathan Wolff]] |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |1996 |Top TV Series |[[Jonathan Wolff (musician)|Jonathan Wolff]] |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |1997 |Top TV Series |[[Jonathan Wolff (musician)|Jonathan Wolff]] |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |1998 |Top TV Series |[[Jonathan Wolff (musician)|Jonathan Wolff]] |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |1999 |Top TV Series |[[Jonathan Wolff (musician)|Jonathan Wolff]] |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |} === ACE Eddie Awards === {| class="wikitable" |- ! (Archived copy) | publisher=British Comedy Awards | url=http://www.britishcomedyawards.com/pastwinners01.html |accessdate=2008-03-18}} |style="background: #ddffdd"| Won |- |} === People's Choice Awards === ''Seinfeld'' has won four [[People's Choice Award]]s from 1996 - 1998. In 1999 it was tied with [[Frasier]].{{cite news | title= 1999 People's Choice Awards (Archived copy) | publisher=People's Choice Awards | url=http://www.pcavote.com/pca/history.jsp?year=1999 |accessdate=2008-05-15}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} {| class="wikitable" |- !
